intro: Astragalus monspessulanus var. vandasii, commonly known as the Vanda's milkvetch, is a rare and specialized plant native to the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its small, yellow flowers and trifoliate leaves. The plant is typically found in rocky or limestone soils, thriving in sunny, arid environments. Its unique morphology and limited distribution make it a subject of interest for botanists and conservationists. Due to habitat loss and environmental changes, it is considered endangered in many areas.
